description: Launched in November 1995 from Vandenberg Air Force Base in California, RADARSAT-1 was the first commercial Earth observation mission of the Canadian Space Agency (CSA), and was developed in cooperation with Canadian provincial governments and the private sector. It used a microwave radar sensor to monitor environmental changes and Earthâ€™s natural resources, with applications in agriculture, land cover monitoring, forestry, disaster management, interferometry, cartography, hydrology, oceanography, ice studies and coastal monitoring. RADARSAT-1 was operational for 17 years and was decommissioned in March 2013.
title: RADARSAT-1
